page.title: 02Ecology,Weather,Climate.
page.content: The name Snods Edge is a derivative of the Middle English "Snitteren" meaning to snow,and in fact "Snods Edge"is very often the snowline on a wintery day.Winter can be very severe with snow drifts building up on the high level roads.Most of our grid area is at or above 700feet rising in places to 900feet.The worst winter in recent years was 1978_1979 when in both January and March blizzards blocked the roads for more than 3 days. Record low temperatures were recorded in December 1982 when the snow arrived on December 12th and stayed until January 31st;temperatures dropped to as low as -29c,and rarely rose above freezing point for 6 weeks.
